companies.key_findings: Duke Energy has embraced a hybrid work model with most positions requiring 2-3 days in office per week. The company spokesperson stated employees 'can have a hybrid work environment and still get jobs done.' Their new Charlotte headquarters was designed to accommodate not all employees simultaneously, indicating commitment to ongoing flexible work. The specific schedule varies by role, with some departments using a 4x10 schedule (2 days in office, 2 remote) while others may require 3 days in office.

companies.key_findings: Liberty Mutual has a clearly defined hybrid policy requiring 2 days per week in office for employees within 50 miles of major hub locations (Boston, Seattle, Portsmouth, Plano). The policy was implemented in September 2023 and has remained stable through November 2024, even as other companies increased RTO requirements. Notably, the company provided additional flexibility with 7 weeks of fully remote work during summer/holiday periods in 2024. GRS Claims department has more lenient requirements (2 days/month vs 2 days/week). Field adjusters remain fully remote. The company is redesigning office spaces to accommodate the hybrid model.

companies.company_name: The University of Kansas Health System
companies.current_policy: Role-dependent - Hybrid and remote options available for eligible administrative/clinical support positions

policy_details.typical_schedule: Varies significantly by role - clinical positions typically require on-site presence; administrative and IT positions may qualify for hybrid or remote arrangements
policy_details.flexibility: As a healthcare provider, most clinical and patient-facing roles require on-site work. Administrative, IT, and certain clinical analyst positions may be eligible for hybrid or remote work. No standardized company-wide policy publicly available.

sources.note: Multiple remote and hybrid positions advertised including Epic Clinical Analyst I (Remote), Administrative Assistant (Hybrid)
FlexJobs lists part-time and alternative schedule flexibility for certain roles
3.9/5 overall rating with 874+ reviews; 3.7/5 work-life balance rating

companies.key_findings: The University of Kansas Health System, as an academic medical center, maintains a role-dependent approach to remote and hybrid work. Clinical and patient-facing positions require on-site presence due to the nature of healthcare delivery. However, the organization offers remote and hybrid arrangements for eligible administrative, IT, and clinical support positions (e.g., Epic analysts, HR administrative roles). The health system has not announced broad RTO mandates and continues to advertise remote and hybrid positions in 2024-2025, suggesting a stable, flexible approach for non-clinical roles.

challenges: Air Products & Chemicals: No formal company-wide RTO policy publicly announced. Information pieced together from job postings and employee reviews.
AH Group: Could not verify ranking on Fortune's Most Innovative Companies 2025 list. Minimal public information about work policies available.
Duke Energy: Policy varies by department; no single standardized announcement found. Information from multiple sources including job postings and employee reports.
Liberty Mutual: Most comprehensive and well-documented policy among the five companies.
Kansas Health System: As expected for healthcare, policy is highly role-dependent. Limited formal policy documentation but job postings indicate ongoing hybrid/remote options.

confidence_notes.high: Liberty Mutual - Multiple consistent sources from news articles, employee reports, and official announcements
confidence_notes.medium: Duke Energy and Kansas Health System - Information from job postings and employee feedback, though not formal policy announcements
confidence_notes.low: Air Products & Chemicals and AH Group - Limited public information, pieced together from various sources without formal policy confirmation

overall_trends.summary: Among these 5 companies from Fortune's Most Innovative Companies 2025 list, hybrid work remains the dominant model where applicable. Liberty Mutual has the most clearly defined policy (2 days/week in office for those within 50 miles of hubs). Duke Energy offers flexible hybrid arrangements (2-3 days/week). Air Products maintains flexibility without a standardized policy. Healthcare organizations (Kansas Health System) maintain role-dependent policies with remote options for administrative roles. None of the companies showed evidence of tightening RTO policies in 2024-2025; most are maintaining stable hybrid arrangements.
